repnme.cdata!:
Brazil - Public Sector Management, Private
            Sector Finance, Rio Grande Do Sul State Reform, Rio de
            Janeiro State Reform Privatization & Mato Grosso State
            Privatization Projects

abstracts.cdata!:
The ratings for the projects for Brazil
            were as follows. Public Sector Management Loan: the outcome
            was moderately satisfactory, the sustainability was likely,
            the institutional development was modest, the Bank and
            borrower performance were both unsatisfactory. Private
            Sector Finance Loan: the outcome was moderately
            satisfactory, the sustainability was likely, the
            institutional development was modest, the Bank performance
            was unsatisfactory, and the borrower performance was
            satisfactory. Rio Grande Do Sul State Reform Loan: the
            outcome was moderately satisfactory, the sustainability was
            likely, the institutional development was modest, the Bank
            performance was satisfactory, and the borrower performance
            was unsatisfactory. Rio the Janeiro State Reform
            Privatization Loan: the outcome was satisfactory, the
            sustainability was likely, the institutional development was
            modest, the Bank performance was highly satisfactory, and
            the borrower performance was satisfactory. Mato Grosso State
            Privatization Loan: the outcome was satisfactory, the
            sustainability was likely, the institutional development was
            substantial, and the Bank and borrower performance were both
            satisfactory. The major lessons of general applicability
            from the five loans assessed include: Continuity of Bank
            interventions is important for promoting lasting
            institutional change. Sub-national programmatic loans offer
            advantages, in this respect, over time-bound State Reform
            Loan (SRLs). The principles of the Levy Report remain
            relevant for designing financial sector lending operations.
            Credit lines (financial intermediary loans) are unlikely to
            be appropriate instruments for supporting financial sector
            adjustment. Reconciling project expenditures fully and
            correctly at closing is a core Bank responsibility. An
            oversight agency operating within an appropriate regulatory
            framework is an important prerequisite to successful
            privatization of public services. As investment loans, the
            SRLs proved to be cumbersome instruments for supporting
            structural change.

repnme.cdata!:
Brazil - Rio de Janeiro State Reform
            Privatization Project

abstracts.cdata!:
The outcome of the Rio Je Janeiro State
            Reform Privatization Project was satisfactory - it achieved
            most of its major privatization objective and has
            established a supportive regulatory framework. The main
            lessons include the following: 1) Privatizing or liquidating
            a state bank requires sustained political commitment at the
            highest level of state government. 2) Unless necessary,
            splitting should be avoided, as dealing with the
            "remnants" to be liquidated carry a large
            administrative and legal burden for the state after
            privatization. 3) It is essential to identify and deal
            up-front with the problem of hidden liabilities,
            particularly unfunded pension liabilities. 4) Private
            management contracts are useful to prepare a bank for
            privatization when years of bad management and poor records
            make valuation and the identification of hidden liabilities
            difficult. Remuneration of the private manager based on
            incremental operational results is an effective incentive to
            good management. 5) Success fees expressed as a percentage
            of privatization proceeds are a good incentive to proper
            valuation of the minimum price and active sale promotion. 6)
            Governments should avoid as much as possible granting
            exclusivity rights to the management of state accounts to
            former public banks.

repnme.cdata!:
Brazil - Rio de Janeiro State
            Reform-Privatization Project

abstracts.cdata!:
The Rio de Janeiro State
            Reform-Privatization Project's main objective is to
            support the state's privatization and concession
            program, and increase efficiency in the delivery of urban
            transport and utility services.  During preparation, the aim
            has been to improve the quality of the design of the
            state's privatization and concession program and assist
            in its initial phase of implementation.  The project itself
            will ensure that implementation is completed as planned.
            The components of the project are the following: 1)
            privatization of BANERJ SA and of BANERJ Insurance SA as
            well as liquidation of Banco do Estado do Rio de Janeiro SA
            and of its pension fund; 2) establishment of a new
            regulatory framework for the private provision of public
            services; 3) concession of the services of Rio's main
            urban transport agencies and divestiture of their
            non-operational assets; 4) privatization of the energy
            companies--the electricity company CERJ and the gas company
            CEG; 5) concession of water and sanitation services; and 6)
            satisfactory review of the 1997 fiscal performance.
